page.title: 08THE RIVER COLN, FAIRFORD
page.content: The part of the river in the section that we are covering runs upstream from the town bridge, opposite Busby's Garage, then along to the village of {Quenington.} From the town bridge to {Fairford Mill}the river is straight. In this section it runs past the slopimg gardens of Fairford House and past the church. The fishing rights here belong to the{Bull Hotel.} Beyond the Mill, with its mill pool, the water belongs to the{Ernest Cook {Trust.} Travelling upstream there is a slow moving wide section, known locally as{Broadwater.} The river, which is a tributary of the{River {Thames,}is renowned for its trout fishing. Although the public can buy a day's fishing on the Bull Hotel stretch, the other section is strictly private.
